title: Liverpool in transfer race with Borussia Dortmund and Barcelona for Ferran Torres
text:
Liverpool are keeping close tabs on Valencia midfielder Ferran Torres (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool are reportedly in a three-way transfer race to sign Valencia star Ferran Torres, according to reports.

Torres broke into Valencia’s first-team back in 2017 and the 19-year-old has alerted Europe’s elite to his potential with a string of impressive performances for the La Liga outfit this term.

According to SportBild, Borussia Dortmund and Barcelona are both chasing the highly promising Spain Under-21 international ahead of the January transfer window.

The report claims Liverpool are also very interested in Torres, with Jurgen Klopp on the hunt for attacking reinforcements to provide support for Mohamed Salah, Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino.

Though Torres is tied into a deal with Valencia until 2021, the Spanish club are open to offers for the youngster.

It’s understood Valencia would do business for a fee of around €20m (£17m) at the end of the season.

The Spaniard is being watched by Liverpool, Barca and Dortmund (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool are also looking to strengthen in midfield and, earlier this month, Lewis Cook was heavily linked with the Merseyside giants.

However the Bournemouth and England midfielder played down rumours of a potential move to Anfield.

‘I have just started playing football here [again],’ Cook said.

‘I had been out for a long time, so I am just focusing on Bournemouth at the moment.

‘I’m loving being back and playing football. I just forget about it [the speculation] really.

‘You’ve just got to focus on your football here and keep enjoying it. I am obviously enjoying playing football again – that’s all I am focusing on right now.’
